noun.description: The flow of a fluid through a vessel or valve in the body in a direction opposite to normal.
examples: the majority of leg ulcer patients are elderly with simple superficial vein reflux
the main culprit is bile reflux, a backup of digestive fluid that is supposed to remain in the small intestine

noun.description: The process of boiling a liquid so that any vapor is liquefied and returned to the stock.
examples: the mixture was heated at reflux under nitrogen

verb.description: (of a fluid) flow backwards through a vessel or valve in the body.
examples: acidic secretions of the stomach can reflux back upwards

verb.description: Boil or cause to boil in circumstances such that the vapor returns to the stock of liquid after condensing.
examples: the liquid is allowed to reflux until the thermometer records the lowest temperature possible
the solutions were refluxed for 9–12 hours

origin: Middle English: from re- and flux.
